intro: Machaerina hirta, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters at the top of the stems. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Machaerina hirta has historical significance for its use by Māori in the construction of traditional items.
